snippet: Large numbers of foreign troops would almost certainly be needed to safeguard inspectors working in the midst of the civil war.
abstract: Experts in monitoring weapons facilities warn that any effort to account for Syria's chemical weapons will require huge investments of resources and time; say large number of foreign troops will almost certainly be needed to safeguard inspectors working in the midst of civil war.

byline.original: By WILLIAM J. BROAD and C. J. CHIVERS
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Washington, and Karam Shoumali from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: Large numbers of foreign troops would almost certainly be needed to safeguard inspectors working in the midst of the civil war.

headline.main: Chemical Disarmament Hard Even in Peacetime
headline.print_headline:
Chemical Disarmament Tough
Even Without a War Going On

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
